text: very proud of this budget against a backdrop of brexit amp tory austerity we re investing strongly in the economy public services amp tackling the climate crisis i am also v proud of who has stepped up in tough circumstances and shown what a talent she is
read my full brexit day speech on scottish independence here
just over an hour left to cast your vote vote to get tories out escape brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands this election really matters and every vote will count
polls are now open in vote to lock the tories out escape brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands

nowhere better to end the campaign than in the gorbals with the brilliant good luck to all candidates and teams tomorrow i m so proud of all of you let s lock the tories out escape brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands
seven days to stop boris johnson escape the brexit mess and put scotland s future in scotland s hands
polls no matter how good don t win elections only votes do only can beat the tories in scotland provide an escape route from brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands

this pic from today s campaign stop with in clarkston captures my fave conversation of the day marie yo was telling me why she didn t like brexit i also got short shrift when i tried to pinch one of her marshmallows a very smart wee girl future fm i think

the tory party has now effectively become the brexit party is the main challenger in all of their scottish seats defeating the tories here will help deprive boris johnson s increasingly extreme and right wing party of the majority they crave

any form of brexit that is acceptable to nigel farage will be deeply damaging for scotland makes it all the more important to get rid of boris johnson s tories escape brexit and put scotland s future into scotland s hands
successful campaign launch in edinburgh this morning making the case for people to vote snp to get rid of boris johnson escape brexit and put scotland s future into scotland s hands

lots of enthusiastic supporters of out in alloa today winning seats like this from the tories is the main challenger in all scottish tory seats will help us escape the brexit mess and put scotland future in scotland s hands

this makes a no deal brexit a significant risk in fact given the likely impossibility of agreeing a trade deal in less than a year it would make it almost inevitable in a nutshell this is a reason to get tory mps out is the challenger in all scottish tory seats
what a brilliant champion for scotland has been in the house of commons throughout this brexit mess if you agree please support his campaign for re election
join me tomorrow in george square for rally let s stop brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands
great time in leith this morning with the fantastic in to escape the chaos of brexit and put scotland s future in scotland s hands

seeing lots of chat this morning about tactical voting to maximise remain vote is the challenger in every tory held seat in scotland so if you want to stop brexit and remove boris johnson is the only way to do it
is on and is up and running i ll be joining in stirling tomorrow as we launch our campaign to stop brexit and demand scotland s right to choose independence good luck to all our candidates and teams

finally all of this brexit chaos is being imposed on scotland against our will to stop this ever happening again we need to be independent which is why the demand for will be at heart of campaign ends

to change the course johnson is taking us on we need to beat him i accept that challenge for in scotland other parties have to do the same elsewhere in uk doing nothing almost guarantees he gets what he wants brexit delivered possibly through no deal

for all his bluster johnson would much prefer to fight an election with brexit already delivered an election now would instead force him to explain his failure to keep his october do or die promise and also defend his bad deal
as the brexit chaos continues a message from me and to eu nationals living in scotland

so johnson appears to be saying to mps if you vote for an election i ll bring back my bad brexit bill and try to drag us out of the eu before we go to the polls elections should be exercises in letting voters decide not devices for charlatans to get their own way

we ve seen today that even the westminster brexit secretary hasn t yet grasped the details of this deal trying to ram through legislation of this complexity significance and long lasting consequences in just days is an abomination of scrutiny and democracy

johnson has broken virtually every past promise he has made on brexit how anyone could believe promises he makes now on workers rights or anything else is beyond me caveat emptor should be the words ringing in ears of any labour mp thinking of backing this deal
very proud of this guy as leader of westminster group has played a blinder opposing brexit and standing up for scotland good to catch up with him in his commons office earlier

good to catch up with the snp mp group in the commons today so proud of the work they do to stand up for scotland s interests every day they re doing everything possible to stop brexit but also demonstrating that the best future for scotland is independence

hope i m wrong but i have a real suspicion that labour would be quite happy to see this deal go through they will officially oppose but give nod to rebels to ensure numbers there to pass it will be the end of them in scotland if they do end up facilitating brexit
brexit has shown that the only way for scotland to be in charge of our own future is to become independent that why we must have next year
mps should not fall for a deal no deal framing no brexit revoke is always an alternative to no deal

seems to me that no one who voted against may s deal on basis it lacked strong enough assurances about closeness of future relationship could possibly vote for this much harder brexit beckons if this deal passes
the uk government s attempt to shift the blame for the brexit fiasco to anyone but themselves today it s merkel is pathetically transparent

hard to see how the uk government brexit proposals fly and hard to escape conclusion that they re designed to fail for scotland the fundamental point remains these proposals would take us out of the eu single market and customs union against our will that s unacceptable
hard to overstate how big a blunder supporting a no deal brexit is from jackson carlaw

in supporting a catastrophic no deal brexit the scottish tories are putting the demands of boris johnson ahead of the interests of the scottish people who voted overwhelmingly against any kind of brexit

johnson should stop his shameful game playing if he requests an extension and removes risk of no deal on october will vote for an election the ball s in his court but he must think we button up the back if he believes we ll let him force through a no deal brexit
he can t have it both ways either prorogation was nothing to do with brexit as he claimed or having prorogation declared unlawful frustrates brexit it can t be both
labour rejects a clear pro remain position and instead stays firmly perched on the brexit fence an abdication of leadership
staying neutral on brexit is a shameful abdication of leadership
and when the election does come as it soon will will put scotland s opposition to brexit and our right to choose our own future as an independent nation at the very heart of the contest
an early general election is now a question of when not if but johnson mustn t be allowed to dictate the timing as a device to avoid scrutiny and force through a no deal brexit
not allowing johnson to cut and run for an election simply as a tactic to force through a no deal brexit is one thing and why opposition right to insist on passage of anti no deal bill but
scotland voted to remain in the eu and yet not a single scottish tory mp voted to prevent a no deal brexit tonight
as talk of a general election mounts i say bring it on but it must be before oct mps must not allow johnson to game the date as a ploy to push through a no deal brexit
open letter on the eve of poll from the excellent say no to brexit vote snp

given her past statements opposing a no deal brexit it would be good to have confirmation from ruth davidson today that all scots tory mps will back the cross party effort next week to stop it and that they will also oppose boris johnson s attempt to shut down parliament

so it seems that boris johnson may actually be about to shut down parliament to force through a no deal brexit unless mps come together to stop him next week today will go down in history as a dark one indeed for uk democracy

to be clear remains willing to work across party lines and explore all options to stop a no deal brexit jeremy corbyn s suggestion is not the only possible option but given the circumstances nothing should be ruled out at this stage should rethink
most immediately i and will work with others to do everything we can to block his plan for a no deal brexit which would do catastrophic harm to scotland

ruth davidson is supporting a candidate who says he favours a catastrophic no deal brexit over no brexit at all what a turn around from the great remainer of wembley stadium and hard to imagine a position more out of touch with the vast majority in scotland
what a horror show the tory leadership election is tax cuts for the richest attacks on abortion rights hypocrisy on drugs continued brexit delusion true colours well and truly on show

some way off can someone tell jeremy that a disastrous no deal brexit on october is currently the default option he needs to get off the fence asap and support a second referendum unequivocally there is no time to waste

this is jaw dropping from telling people in that brexit would be a disaster to now seeking support for a tory candidate because he voted for brexit there is not a shred of principle or consistency at play here

just published a bill to set the rules for an independence referendum to allow the scottish people to choose our own future rather than having a brexit future imposed on us will update later on it and our plans for cross party talks and a citizens assembly
congratulations to our new meps and and thanks to all our fantastic candidates thank you also to all who voted for us and delivered this historic result scotland has spoken we are not for brexit

obviously i m delighted with result but genuinely sad for he has been an excellent mep and passionately anti brexit he was one of the very last labour people who deserved to pay the price for his party s prevarication
formal declaration to come but clear now that has won the euro election emphatically we are on course to take out of seats a historic victory and scotland has rejected brexit again

outstanding results so far tonight for on course for our best ever euro election result polling way ahead of any other party higher in scotland than brexit party s current share in ruk emphatically clear that scotland doesn t want brexit

that boris johnson as pm is a serious proposition is proof that the tories have taken leave of their senses nothing apart from brexit obvs has done more to trash the uk s global reputation in last three years than his risible tenure as foreign secretary

the prospect of an even more hardline brexiteer now becoming pm and threatening a no deal exit is deeply concerning added to the experience of the past three years this makes it all the more important that scotland is given the choice of becoming an independent country

her departure will not solve the brexit mess that the tories have created only putting the matter back to the people can do that given current circumstances it also feels deeply wrong for another tory to be installed in number without a general election

i wish theresa may well she and i had profound disagreements not least on her handling of brexit and her disregard for scotland s interests however leadership is tough especially in these times and she deserves thanks for her service

there s a pattern here when bad things look unlikely to happen ie brexit before the referendum or boris as pm a few months ago ruth davidson opposes them because it s safe but when these things do happen or look likely to she falls meekly into line that s not leadership

met earlier with people from other eu countries who live in scotland my message is that they are welcome here and we want them to stay by voting on thursday scotland can send a clear message that we don t want brexit and all the damage it will do
in pm s own words if mps vote against the bill they will be voting to stop brexit that is what will do because scotland did not vote for brexit
good visit with to fish processor j charles in aberdeen earlier to hear concerns about the damage brexit will do to business thanks to andrew and his team for the warm welcome
delighted to launch manifesto for the with our fantastic team of candidates on thursday let s send a clear message that scotland s not for brexit scotland s for europe
the recommendation to voters in scotland from this research is explicit and clear if you want to stop brexit vote

great visit to my alma mater this morning to talk about the work they are doing to support staff and students from other eu countries during the brexit uncertainty thanks for the welcome and for giving me one of the uni s new diversity badges

for some bad jokes tired lines and ample evidence that the tories are way out of touch with scottish opinion on brexit here s a preview of ruth davidson s conference speech courtesy of the tories who forgot to switch the mic off during the practice

the scottish tories have got themselves in a corner they are now a brexit supporting party in an overwhelmingly remain country which already narrows appeal but they also can t even claim to have delivered brexit not much principle or strategic nous on display
if the message labour takes from english local elections is that they should now be the facilitator of a tory brexit i suspect their troubles will just be beginning

confirmation if it was needed that labour is a brexit supporting party problem is a labour brexit just like a tory brexit will hurt scotland so if you want to keep scotland in europe and make sure that our voice is heard vote on may

this is an excellent piece by about how we learn from the grave errors of the brexiteers build an inclusive case for independence and value the bonds of friendship that will always endure across our islands well worth a read
great piece from whose clarity of insight and commentary on brexit is always first class
if the detail of this is true and i accept it is only an if labour will never be forgiven a deal that would see them vote for a tory brexit with a nod and a wink agreement to kill off a people s vote

this blog from explains why snp mps voted as we did last night we prioritised options that would stop brexit and remove the risk of a no deal exit but we also showed a willingness to compromise by voting for a single market customs unions option

genuinely can t think of any good reason why labour mps would not vote for option tonight it provides an insurance policy against a no deal brexit and doesn t mean that article couldn t be triggered again in future if uk manages to work out what it wants

really important to remember that tonight s votes are not on a preferential basis an snp vote for sm cu would only be to keep that option alive in case it later becomes only alternative to a harder brexit our preference is stopping brexit

snp will decide votes when we see detail of what is selected later today s vote is not on a preferential basis so there may be an opportunity to keep alive least worst options against no deal hard brexit but to be clear our preference is not soft brexit it is no brexit

today in scotland the new domestic abuse act comes into force free personal care is extended to the under s prescription charges rise to in england but remain without charge here as the uk government is consumed by brexit is getting on with the job
the most important motion laid today is this one from it makes revoking article rather than a no deal brexit the default option if parliament can t agree a way forward i hope all parties will support

so while the tories say this about labour their attack line on the snp in scotland is that today s vote will cause a no deal brexit someone should tell them we can see all their tweets but just so they re in no doubt the snp is trying to stop brexit
labour mps are not really about to save pm s skin and usher in a tory brexit are they
a very welcome ray of sunshine in this otherwise sad sorry brexit mess has been the laugh out loud brilliance of

part of the problem already with the withdrawal agreement and political declaration is that it means agreeing to leave the eu with no clarity about the future ie a blindfold brexit take away the pd completely and that problem is compounded why would mps agree to that
some nice non brexit news spring has sprung can t wait to start this at the weekend

the first preference of has always been to stop brexit if that s not possible and until relatively recently it seemed it wasn t we d opt for soft brexit over hard but stopping brexit is possible now and we voted tonight to give that the best chance

if brexit ends up being forced through on the basis of a deal no one supports indeed a deal so bad that the pm has to promise to resign to get it through it will make an already bad project even worse
any mp who is serious about stopping a no deal brexit has to vote for amendment tonight it s as simple as that

i ll be proud to speak at the march tomorrow scotland voted to remain in but people across the uk must have the chance to get out of this brexit mess whatever scotland s future i hope independent it is in all of our interests for uk to be in the eu

so it seems the eu will give uk an extra two weeks to avoid a no deal brexit imperative now that parliament takes control away from pm and uses that time to agree a way forward preferably asking for a longer extension to put the issue back to voters
an issue as big and important as brexit should not come down to petitions that said if you are frustrated that the pm is just not listening you can sign here

about to chair a meeting of resilience committee preparing for the possibility of a no deal brexit only upside is that it saves me from and listening to this weak pm failing to stand up to the hardliners and risking no deal instead she needs to go

and the feeling grows that ultimately labour will be the handmaidens of a tory brexit i so want to be proved wrong on this in spite of the fact that it would be their political death knell in scotland
and still the pm s choice is to pander to the hard brexiteers instead of trying to find a more inclusive way forward so utterly wrongheaded

if you are a brexiteer what does it say about your project if it has to be founded on a deal that a majority believes to be fundamentally flawed that cannot be the way to proceed which is why pm should accept defeat change course and accept this opportunity for a rethink
my comment on tonight s brexit fiasco

just chaired the latest meeting of resilience meeting on plans for no deal brexit these meetings look at things like supply of medicines and food economic and community impact it s disgraceful that pm s refusal to rule out a no deal exit makes this necessary

watching this makes me feel sad and angry in equal measure tove danish born has lived in scotland for years and asks this reasonable question at why do i have to register the one word answer is brexit tove this is your home scotland wants you here

the justification here from a uk minister for trying to block scotland s right to choose independence is quite something once youve hit the iceberg youre all on it together well actually no scotland does not have to sink with the brexit ship
that makes more sense as a way forward though of course in scotland already has a party that wants to stop brexit his explanation for why labour lost though is way off the mark imo

unusually heard a bit of striking how symbiotic the may corbyn relationship seems collusion of silence on their imploding parties neither showing any leadership on brexit and each one relying on the other s incompetence to obscure their own
the brexit farce gets even more farcical

good to know that some labour mps had courage of convictions to vote for amendment to extend article the fact that the majority didn t underlines concern that labour leadership could be gearing up to be the midwives of a tory brexit

it is clear that her strategy is to run down the clock with empty promises and then attempt to blackmail mps what s not yet clear is if she ll try to blackmail moderate mps with threat of no deal or as per olly robbins bar chat brexit zealots with threat of delay or both
preparing for today s special sessions of resilience committee and cabinet on brexit contingency planning the pm s refusal to rule out a no deal brexit is reckless and negligent

this is a pm clearly prepared to take the uk to the brink and potentially over the cliff edge rather than face down the zealot brexiteers in her own party this mess is not inevitable it is a choice she is making

the extent and sheer absurdity of tory brexit chaos captured in one headline

trying to win a majority in commons for a brexit policy that the eu has made clear it won t agree to does not seem like the pm s most sensible strategy ever

these proposals if they go ahead like brexit generally will diminish the uk in so many ways but it doesn t have to be that way scotland can choose a better future

the issue here is not so much the amount of money it is the principle automatic visa free travel across europe will no longer be a right we can take for granted if brexit goes ahead what a sad retrograde step

hard to see tory leadership vote resolving anything if pm does badly she s damaged if she wins easily it s only because she s promised to go soon making herself a lame duck pm and either way she s still selling a brexit deal parliament won t vote for
as this and my next few rts show amidst all the brexit chaos still gets on with the job

far from attacking labour i am offering to work with you to bring down this awful tory government and clear the way for a second vote as the only way to bring an end to the brexit mess surely it is time for some clear and decisive leadership from all of us

so if labour as official opposition lodges motion of no confidence in this incompetent government tomorrow will support amp we can then work together to give people the chance to stop brexit in another vote this shambles can t go on so how about it

this is worth a read it is make your mind up time for labour there is a realistic prospect now of stopping brexit and if labour stands in its way they will be as culpable for the ensuing mess as the tories
the sheer moral bankruptcy of the tory brexiteers is on full display today

confirmation from the uk government that its brexit deal would put scotland at a competitive disadvantage i support whatever it takes to preserve peace in ni but this comment shows why scotland can t afford to be taken out of eu single market if ni can stay in so must we
if this or any brexit tv debate goes ahead without all options including that of remaining in the eu being included and given a voice it will be an absolute travesty of democracy
how about theresa may stops using independence to avoid questions and responsibility for her brexit mess

just read political declaration lots of unicorns taking the place of facts about the future relationship fair play to the eu for pushing it as far as possible but it adds up to a blindfold brexit difficult issues unresolved so extended transition backstop almost certain
my article in on the current brexit state of play though as the piece makes clear my top preference is not a better brexit but no brexit

point i was making yesterday is that opposition must unite behind an agreed alternative i am happy for that to be another vote but we still have to persuade others for that to command a majority and in meantime keep all alternatives to hard brexit open
stopping eu citizens jumping the queue that the case for brexit has been reduced to such a miserable and self defeating bottom line is depressing in the extreme let s lift our sights higher than this

also though the withdrawal proposals will get most attention initially the declaration on future relationship is just as important if that is vague and dodges tough issues a blindfold brexit would beckon it would be deeply irresponsible for parliament to sanction that
this from on brexit state of play is well worth a read

early start heading to london to make speech as talks reach impasse in brussels will continue to exhaust all possibilities for compromise and common sense staying in single market customs union only credible brexit option for uk

we ll resign if you do anything that makes scotland think there s a better alternative to a hard tory brexit say mundell and davidson first what a bizarre position isn t it their job to stand up for scotland and second have they the gumption to resign i bet they don t

in last two days alone has delivered a pay increase for police put dignity into disability assessments shown that we are building affordable houses at faster rate than uk and more but always glad to hear from our single issue brexit pm

the only remotely workable way to do brexit is to stay in the single market and customs union if pm not prepared to do that brexit shouldn t happen no deal or no detail brexit simply not acceptable especially for scotland where we did not vote for this

a blind brexit with little or no detail on terms of future eu uk relationship would be no more acceptable than a no deal brexit if that s the choice article should be extended to allow all alternative options for scotland and uk to be considered

a no deal brexit would be an unmitigated disaster and the fact that uk govt is even talking about it is evidence of their abject failure that they once had the nerve to tell us that independence threatened our place in europe adds insult to injury scotland deserves better

the economy remains fragile as a result of brexit and focus is on doing all we can to support growth but there s little doubt that opposition claims in recent months about the relative underperformance of the scottish economy are ringing hollow today
good to catch up with north east at earlier to talk brexit implications and new support to promote scotch lamb

only fair that i also tweet this still think that it s often hard to tell difference between corbyn s brexit views and those of the tories

highly recommended read on current state of play it won t cheer you up but it is excellent insight in my view is one of the best brexit commentators around well informed detailed cogent and accessible especially not surprisingly on the irish implications

which let s be frank is pretty disastrous for the prospect of achieving a brexit deal at the least damaging end of the spectrum and i suspect that s the depressing conclusion to be drawn from the events of the last hours

hard to confidently disagree with this right now after hours which has seen pm s total capitulation to the hard brexiteers who actually want no deal outcome and defeat of a sensible compromise customs union amendment
good roundtable discussion at scotland house in london today with and a number of financial services firms about this report reasons to invest in scotland and of course brexit

interesting read on dup brexit donations but tweet from me referenced here was more about the donations to from the scottish unionist association trust my surprise is that the tories are not getting more questions about where the suat money comes from
there s absolutely nothing that jeremy corbyn says here on brexit that theresa may wouldn t say
another dollop of brexit fudge with tory party interests yet again taking priority over the interests of the country

surely this can t be true labour mps saving tories from defeat and denying the house of commons a meaningful vote and the chance to avoid a brexit cliff edge would be inexplicable and unforgivable i hope it doesn t happen

with brexit reducing uk attractiveness overall according to this report there is certainly no room for complacency but the detail of this which is well worth a read shows another year of outstanding scottish success in attracting investment

so we have a choice stay as we are locked into the brexit spiral and continued austerity that the westminster parties offer no alternative to or decide to equip ourselves with the powers to build our way to a better future

reading lots of interesting comments about the which is good so much better to be discussing how to build a successful independent scotland than just resigning ourselves to managing the decline of brexit uk a few points worth underlining though

it is fine that some people are talking about what they don t agree with in report as well as what they do because that means debate is focused on how to build a better country which is so much more constructive than despairing about brexit and westminster

today s excellent report will spark lots of debate within and beyond and that s great so much better to be debating how we maximise our potential as a country than just focussing on how we limit the damage of brexit

says the party obsessed with brexit and whose leader is speaking today at an event called the union and unionism tories objection is not to a debate about the constitution their objection is to a debate in which the independence case is heard
scottish welsh artists speak up for the devolved parliaments and against the uk government s brexit power grab

when published analysis two weeks ago showing the cost of brexit some tories accused us of scaremongering thanks to this leak we now know the uk government is sitting on analysis which comes to precisely the same conclusions

if this is true let s hope not it will show yet again that the views of hardline tory brexiteers are more important to the pm than the interests of the country no deal is unthinkable no brexit should be the clear preference over no deal

an aside a uk government that is able to say that come what may it will avoid hard borders with ireland ni after brexit can never again tell scotland that independence would mean a hard border between scotland and ruk

this could be the moment for opposition and soft brexit remain tories to force a different less damaging approach keep the uk in the single market and customs union but it needs labour to get its act together how about it
